[Summon Butterflies]() is a level 1 [Summoning](/Summonings "Summonings") spell which summons multiple [butterflies](/Butterfly "Butterfly").

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 Tips & tricks](#Tips_.26_tricks)
- [4 Monster version](#Monster_version)
- [5 History](#History)
- [6 References](#References)

## Useful Info

A kaleidoscope of butterflies is created around the caster. Higher [spell power](/Spell_power "Spell power") may result in more butterflies.

Number of summons is `2 + 1d3 + (1d<power> - 1) / 10`, capped at 8.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

Duration of the summons is around 27 turns. It is not affected by spell power.

There is a cap on how many creatures created by this spell you can have at the same time. Summoning more than 8 creatures means that the older ones will time out immediately.

## Strategy

- Summon Butterflies is amazing for making escapes, despite the wimpy name. The butterflies can block your enemies' movement and ranged attacks. At low power the spell only summons a few, but at high power it can surround you completely to a considerable radius.
- The butterflies have no attack. They will fly off in random directions at high speed, making them especially good for blocking corridors.

## Tips & tricks

- If you know spells like [Conjure Flame](/Conjure_Flame "Conjure Flame") or [Freezing Cloud](/Freezing_Cloud "Freezing Cloud"), you can use Summon Butterflies to keep you enemies on top of the clouds for as long as you want.
- For obvious reasons, this spell is also very useful for characters with smite-targeted spells, like [Lee's Rapid Deconstruction](/Lee%27s_Rapid_Deconstruction "Lee's Rapid Deconstruction"), although beware of doing so with gods which punish you hurting allies, like the [good](/Good "Good") gods and [Okawaru](/Okawaru "Okawaru").

## Monster version

The following enemies may be able to cast Summon Butterflies, depending on their spell set:

- & [![Pandemonium lord.png](/images/c/c6/Pandemonium_lord.png)](/File:Pandemonium_lord.png) **[Pandemonium lord](/Pandemonium_lord "Pandemonium lord")** (4.2% chance)

## History

- Prior to [0.26](/0.26 "0.26"), players, [player ghosts](/Player_ghost "Player ghost"), and pandemonium lords could cast this spell. This spell was completely removed from the game, but the [scroll of butterflies](/Scroll_of_butterflies "Scroll of butterflies") or Xom may produce the same effect.
- Prior to [0.23](/0.23 "0.23"), butterflies could be used for detecting hidden [traps](/Trap "Trap").
- In [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), maximum summons per single cast was lowered from 15 to 8.
- Prior to [0.8](/0.8 "0.8") the spell always summoned at least 15 butterflies, regardless of spell power.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [spl-summoning.cc:98](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.25.1/crawl-ref/source/spl-summoning.cc#L98) (0.25.1)
